message: Do you obsess over your phone's home screen like I do? I don't have a tablet, but I'm sure I'd treat it the same way if I did. There's such a delicate balance between function/efficiency and aesthetic calm that must be struck for a good home screen. And don't forget the importance of a perfect background image. What is your thought process when arranging your apps? Do you think about your workflow at all? Do you use different spaces/pages to signify different things? Or do you care at all? Please share your home screen strategies here, and DEFINITELY post screenshots.
As for mine, I think I finally nailed it tonight: http://i.imgur.com/mnAsv.jpg

I thought about folders on the dock, such as one for all "social." I decided against it, though, because I use some WAY more than others. Taking the phone off the dock was the big one for me. I use SMS and Twitter to communicate more than anything else except email, which would make me miserable if it was in the dock.

Camera on the dock is CLUTCH, btw.

It leads me to the conclusion that I don't really need all of these apps on my phone (well over 250), and now I'm trying to reduce the number of folders I use, and start deleting apps. My phone is full. It's ridiculous.

I have an incredibly hard time making decisions on which app to use when there are multiple good ones available for various categories. For example, I like Facebook, FourSquare, Gowalla, FootFeed, and SCVNGR for checkins. This leads me to thick folders of apps all over the place. Then unfortunately I end up rarely using any of them because they are "out of sight, and out of mind" ...
Man I thought having 80 apps was bad

Yeah, that's crazy. Unrelatedly, I've made a great discovery for those of us who like to use web apps like Google Reader on our home screens. Go to http://fullscreen.me on your iOS device. It lets you save full-screen web apps as standalone home screen apps (not run in Safari). You can also set custom icons, and they've got a few of the Google web app icons in retina-friendly size (yay!). I've got one for Google Reader, one for bit.ly, and one for Favstar. Awesome.
It's like Fluid for iOS.
